New Records: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and the Oklahoma City Thunder won their franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season game
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scores 29 points and Thunder win 13th in a row, 116-98 over Clippers
Post-Match Reflections: Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and the Oklahoma City Thunder won their franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season game, 116-98 over the Los Angeles Clippers on Thursday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ivica Zubac with the and-1 bucket
Jalen Williams throws down big flush vs. LA Clippers
Isaiah Joe drains 3 vs. LA Clippers
